snippet: The Obama administration and the Federal Trade Commission said new laws would level the playing field between companies that already have privacy policies and those that don’t.
abstract: Obama administration and the Federal Trade Commission press Congress to enact online privacy legislation, saying new laws would level the playing field between companies that already have privacy policies and those that do not.

byline.contributor: Tanzina Vega contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration and the Federal Trade Commission said new laws would level the playing field between companies that already have privacy policies and those that don’t.

headline.seo: F.T.C. and White House Push for Online Privacy Laws
headline.main: F.T.C. and White House Push for Online Privacy Laws
headline.print_headline: F.T.C. and White House Push for Online Privacy Laws
